definition: to receive/to accept/to enjoy/to bring into/to pay (tax etc)/nano- (one billionth)/to reinforce sole of shoes or stockings by close sewing

sentences.english: What was the tributary system and how will it shape China's future behaviour?
sentences.chinese: 到底什么是纳贡体制，它将使中国成为什么样的国家？

sentences.english: The conquered had to render tribute to the conqueror.
sentences.chinese: 被征服者只得向征服者称臣纳贡。

sentences.english: Also some of the Philistines brought Jehoshaphat presents, and tribute silver;
sentences.chinese: 有些非利士人与约沙法送礼物，纳贡银。

sentences.english: Americans are paying tribute to fallen troops in Memorial Day observances .
sentences.chinese: 美国民众在纪念日仪式上，向沦陷的军队纳贡。

sentences.english: The river and its tributaries are cresting their banks.
sentences.chinese: 河和它的纳贡者正在到达绝顶他们的岸。

definition: to offer tribute/to pay tribute that a vassal owes to his suzerain
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
Ryūkyū/refers to the Ryūkyū Islands 琉球群島|琉球群岛[Liu2 qiu2 Qun2 dao3] stretching from Japan to Taiwan/Liuchiu township in Pingtung County 屏東縣|屏东县[Ping2 dong1 Xian4], Taiwan
